items.content_html:
Summary

Fixes formatting inconsistencies, grammar/punctuation mistakes, informational issues, and residual british english spellings.

Motivation

These changes will improve the clarity and accuracy of the information presented, so as to mitigate any confusion over an already complicated subject.

Supporting details

  • this is the en-US version, so "spatialisation" should be "spatialization", and the main article already uses the american spelling anyway: Web audio spatialization basics
  • the specification for the PannerNode and the AudioListener no longer includes the velocity component

items.content_html:
I added a note to inform people that DataTransfer.files has data only during drop events.

Motivation

Thanks to https://stackoverflow.com/a/33488949/5760141 I finally learned why DataTransfer.files was always empty when I tried to use it in dragover and dragenter event handlers, and so hopefully this note will save other people a lot of time and trouble.

Supporting details

https://stackoverflow.com/a/33488949/5760141
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dnd.html#the-drag-data-store
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dnd.html#concept-dnd-p
items.title: inform people that DataTransfer.files has data only during drop events

items.content_html:
Summary

-  By default, the value is stretch, which stretches all flex items to fill the parent in the direction of the cross axis. If the parent doesn't have a fixed width in the cross axis direction, then all flex items will become as long as the longest flex item.
+  By default, the value is stretch, which stretches all flex items to fill the parent in the direction of the cross axis. If the parent doesn't have a fixed height in the cross axis direction, then all flex items will become as long as the longest flex item.

Motivation

If there is no fixed height. Flex items get stretched as much as long. But, In docs which are specified as fixed width. Width plays a role in the main axis, not in the cross axis.

Supporting details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox#:~:text=If%20the%20parent%20doesn%27t%20have%20a%20fixed%20width%20in%20the%20cross%20axis%20direction

Related issues

Simple typo error

items.content_html:
Summary

  • Fix a link in tabs.onUpdated() page
  • Explain favIconUrl behavior when a page has no favicon

Motivation

Makes clear to developers what to expect of favIconUrl property in both changeInfo parameter of the tabs.onUpdated callback and tabs.Tab, so that they can take into account when a tab loses its favicon (e.g. when navigating from a page that has a favicon to one that doesn’t).

Supporting details

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1450384#c8

Related issues

Fix #4324

items.content_html:
Summary

One-word change at line 81: "... construct different absolute URLs ..." to "... construct different relative URLs ...".

Motivation

I was reading through the docs and this seemed odd. The instructions say to specify an absolute URL and warn that if you specify a relative URL, "different browsers may construct different absolute URLs"? I think it's supposed to be "different browsers may construct different relative URLs", based on the wording and context alone.

I don't know if browsers construct different absolute URLs or relative URLs, so I might be wrong! It just seems weird from a linguistic perspective.

Supporting details

It seems that the cbe151a initial commit already had this issue.

Related issues

Unknown.

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Changed `different absolute` to `different relative`

items.content_html:
Summary

Document what languages various collation types apply to (at present). Document which ones Chrome and Edge exclude. (I didn't test if there are other Chromium-based browsers that undo the exclusions.) Give advice against using types that are unavailable, already defaults, or problematic in the case of unusual naming for Swedish.

Motivation

My main motivation is preparation for Swedish renaming and preparation for aligning Firefox with the exclusions that Chrome already makes.

Supporting details

The language applicability comes from searching CLDR source.

Chrome and Edge exclusions can be seen in the source and verified by a demo.

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Add more information about collation types

items.content_html:
The stack trace is added (if it is) to the object returned by the constructor, not when the object is thrown. This was incorrect in a number of places. Fixed now.

Thanks very much @eqrion

items.content_html:
FF101 adds support to FF Nightly for TransformStreamDefaultController,ReadableStream.pipeThrough via a pref.

This updates the associated docs

  • Add to experimental features
  • General consistency and front matter fixes to above docs.

The docs appear to match the spec and have reasonable examples etc.

Other docs work for this can be tracked in#15469

items.content_html:
** do not merge until all Manifest V3 content is ready **

Summary

Changes to the manifest keys for Manifest V3 support in the developer preview, including:

  • update to the keys list on the overview page to add details of supported manifest versions
  • addition of a "Manifest version" line into the overview table of every manifest key page
  • addition of the action key (as a copy of the browser_action key) with cross-reference information between the two
  • update to favicon_url of the chrome_settings_overrides manifest key that a local URL must be provided in MV3.

Metadata

This PR…

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: MV3 Manifest keys updates

items.content_html:
Summary

Drop 0 from fractionalSecondDigits values spec.
Because it is incorrect with Intl API Spec.

Motivation

Actually web browsers does not implement to allow 0 for fractionalSecondDigits, and throws RangeError when using fractionalSecondDigits: 0.
I confirmed with Chrome v101, Safari v15.4, Firefox v99 and Node.js v16,v17.

Supporting details

fractionalSecondDigits does not allow 0 in ECMAScript® 2021 Internationalization API Specification.
https://402.ecma-international.org/8.0/#sec-datetimeformat-abstracts

Related issues

tc39/ecma402#590

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Drop `0` from fractionalSecondDigits values spec.
